Comments_List: This course definitely expanded my knowledge of the South Asian diaspora community in the US, but also helped me better contextualize India's  culture and the factors that shape it.
It's a great course on how Indians find ways to connect with their heritage even while living abroad. Seema Ji makes this class so wonderful to be a part of.
We learnt a lot about the Indian diaspora community in the United States and around the world. We read a good amount of Susham Bedi stories and watched a lot of informative Hindi and English movies.
I believe I developed a greater appreciation of Hindi literature, and also learnt a great deal about the Indian diaspora in America.
this course helped me understand different valued connected to Diaspora and the people around the globe representing India.
There are lots of great readings and films that help us discover our answers in a fun, engaging way.
Seemaji is an extremely sweet and knowledgeable professor and the class was fun and engaging.
The course was rather well structured, and the small class size allowed us to really dive into the issues that we were studying in depth.
This course did not have as much work as I expected it would have, but it was engaging in terms of discussions and topics discussed.
Yes. Seema Ji is the absolute best. You'll have so much fun and learn interesting things about Indian culture.
Yes! The class was interesting and engaging and a great language credit if youre a native speaker.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. It serves as an interesting analysis of the lives of the diaspora community, and studying the diaspora in their language is an especially interesting way to do it.
